intro: Bonamia cymosa, commonly known as the common bonamia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and ovate leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Bonamia cymosa is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
